data.title: A hidden gem in Downtown Hollywood
data.text: Our normal place where friends gather around the bar.  Great bar bites menu.  And then we all stay for dinner.   Great food and service, with a limited menu but all with excellent tastes and presentations.  It baffles me, that Lola's doesn't have more customers on a nightly basis.  You are missing out!!

data.title: TOO MUCH ATTITUDE
data.text: My friend and I had a reservation for Lola's on a recent Sat. night. When we arrived to the small restaurant, the hostess acted like she would try to accommodate us, and sat us at a table near the bar. However, just a few minutes later, she took a couple from the bar to a table in a more desirable location. Then, when ordering, I asked a simple question about whether I could substitute beans on one of the specials. The waiter hautily informed me "the chef does NOT substitute on specials" versus just saying, "I'm sorry, but we don't substitute." The food was decent, but the vibe put a damper on the experience.

data.title: Customer
data.text: Excellent food. Pleasant dining experience.  Not a noisy environment. Service excellent. Thumbs up for cocacola ribs.  Fish fresh with pleasant flavors.  Chocolate peanut butter pie to die for!

data.title: They Serve Dogs At the Table While You Eat
data.text: This small upscale setting was clean and fresh looking with a simple decor.  It was busy upon arrival but we were well greeted and sat quickly.  I asked the waiter to bring his favourite... boy what great choices.  He said the ribs were the signiture dish and I must say they were fantastic.  The pork chops were the best I have ever tried.  I cannot say enough about how incredibly fantastic the food was.  However we were half way through the appetizers before the drinks came to our table, we were told the bartender was serving wine across the street.  Just as our main courses were delivered a local patron arrived and was seated next to us with their dog. The owner stood and gossiped about the neighbours (annoying).  A small bowl of water was delivered to their table so that the dog could drink... right from the table top beside us while we ate.  The server came over to pet the dog and then quickly left to deliver 2 salad plates.  Then came to our table to refresh our water glasses.  Are you f__ing kidding me, I absolutely know he did not wash his hands, I refused the top up and finished quickly to leave.  I did not feel good about leaving this fool a tip but did not want to short change the kitchen. I asked the server and was told that the kitchen does not get a part of the tip.  Too bad for him because the kitchen is the real strength in this business!

data.title: Private party
data.text: We had a private party for my university here and it was very nice.  The wine was flowing and it was the good stuff and the appetizers were absolutely delicious.  Very friendly staff.

data.title: Consistently delicious food and superb service!
data.text: If you haven't had the pleasure of dining at Lola's on Harrison in Hollywood, FL you are missing out.  The excellent service and atmosphere are icing on the cake of the delicious dishes.  The Coca Cola Ribs and Grouper are two of my favorites!  Also, if you are lucky enough to catch the Bolognese on the special menu it is a must!  Make sure you try this great place!!

data.title: wonderful experience!
data.text: Everything about Lola's was first class! Great food , service, wine list and decor. Everyone in our group loved the beef ribs.  ( but they are pretty spicy) The mussels appetizer was great. We were with good friends we haven't seen in a long time and we appreciated it that we were not rushed and had the table for the entire evening.

data.title: Truly Exceptional
data.text: Lola's is an impressive restaurant with a creative menu that is thoughtfully crafted by an extremely talented chef.  The wine list is thoughtfully selected. I had the special - a handmade ricotta gnocci in a pesto cream sauce that was heavenly.  My husband had the lamb, which was cooked to perfection. The service is very attentive.  We will definitely be back!

data.title: GOURMET DINING IN HOLLYWOOD, FLORIDA
data.text:
Gourmet dining in Hollwood

Enjoy a nightly happy hour free parking, and top it off with a gourmet meal. We did such an outing this past Saturday . We started our meal with warm bread and shared a wedge salad, sufficient to feed 2 hungry people. My husband enjoyed the rack of lamb while I the bronzino with eggplant and rice. I asked for mine to be light on the salt , and the chef accommodated my request graciously. We shared the blueberry crumble warm and topped with vanilla ice cream. So much for healthy eating. It was tasty and worth every calorie. Our server Carlos was very efficient and inconspicuous when refilling our wine glasses. FYI you can bring your own wine, and they will be happy to open it and ice it for you. It is reasonable charge. Coffee was fresh and hot, the perfect way to end a meal. We have decided make Lola, our go to neighborhood place for a local excellent dinner. Reservations are accepted and they accept all credit cards.

data.title: Great local restaurant
data.text: Lola's on Harrison is a beautiful local restaurant that we have never been disappointed.  Great food,  Great service

data.title: Great food
data.text: I go to this place every time a certain wealthy relative comes into town. It's pretty nice interior and good waiters waitresses. The food is great you can't go wrong with anything they have a lot of very unique things on their menu. From what I remember you could get duck, lambchops... really it is a chef inspired restaurant they must have a good chef

data.title: Angry Shrimp didn't leave me angry!
data.text:
First time here last night.  Service was excellent.  Wine suggestion by the waiter was excellent.  The Angry Shrimp was great (not crazy about the grits with shrimp through).  The heat was at first subtle and then gained strength.  (Awesome!).  I had the Miso Seared Atlantic Salmon @ $24.  Very nice and since I don't eat red meat, my dining comrade told me that I really missed the boat by not having the COCA-COLA® BBQ BEEF RIBS @ $32 (which are HUGE!).  Dessert was coffee and dark chocolate peanut butter pie with a salted pretzel crust and fresh whipped cream.  (TO DIE FOR!!)

I'm DEFINITELY going back!  An excellent dining experience.

data.title: Great meal
data.text: Found this place on various travel sites, was surprised by a great meal.  Small place with 10 to 15 tables, great service.

data.title: Great Venue
data.text: Reserved a table for Saturday night with only 2hrs notice. Friendly atmosphere and good service. Amazing menu. Ribs were great and desserts to die for. Varied beer and cocktail menu. Prices as expected for quality and location.

data.title: charming spot
data.text: very romantic spot in downtown Hollywood. very interesting food, very good. looking forward to returning

data.title: Wonderful Neighborhood Restaurant!!!
data.text: Tucked away on Harrison Street this upscale,charming restaurant brings you back for more. Great Happy Hour, Bar Bites and consistently great dinners.Owners are very cordial, service is top notch and bartender is terrific..  Will be coming back again and again.

data.title: Great food -- downtown Hollywood's fine food gem
data.text: We dine out a lot in South Florida, and when I'm in Hollywood, Lola's is our favorite.  We love the food -- almost always starting with the crab-cakes.  Of late, the branzino is my favorite, but I've enjoyed every entrée I've ordered.  The service is top-notch.

data.title: A classy haven in Hollywood
data.text:
From the moment we arrived and were greeted by owner, Audra,  we felt welcomed.  We sat at the bar for about an hour - which is about 45 minutes more than we ever spend at a bar! - and were served amazing drinks.  I had a ginger pear Bellini and it was delicious.  There were four of us dining and we sat at a table in the window.  It was a rainy night (how many of those have we had lately) and we felt dry, warm and safe.  

We started with a table full of appetizers.  Pork Belly Tacos, Angry Shimp Tacos, Warm Baked Brie and a special Duck Liver Pate.  For our entrees we had Filet Mignon (two of them) , Sirloin Steak and I ordered the Chicken Milanese with tomato basil salsa and Arugula Salad.  Everything was perfectly cooked and delicious.  We didn't leave a drop on our plates and these were not small portions.  For dessert we had the Key Lime and Raspberry Cheesecake and the Chocolate Peanut Butter Pie.  

I would not hesitate to recommend this restaurant and will surely go back.  Especially when I have friends and family from out of town.  Show off a little!

data.title: Great food.
data.text: 2nd. Time at Lola's for the same reason. Sure to have a good meal seved in the proper manner. Service is fast and the menu is offering specials that you can trust. Wine list is a little expensive but that is the only negative point of this great restaurant.

data.title: Excellent food with great service.!
data.text: I was on a business trip in Hollywood and was very lucky to have come across Lola's. The staff was wonderful, very friendly and solicitous.  The food was exceptional. We had the Brie with figs and honey... Out of this world.  For dinner the short ribs were mouth watering with the meat falling off the bone.  Order the creamed corn, superb.  Cappuccinos and desert a great end to a fantastic meal.  Only one regret I live in NY and will not get to eat at Lola's until I visit Hollywood again.
